title: Australian diary. No. 003 (A)
creator_contributor_role: Australian National Film Board, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Fashion - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Child care services
description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a look at a Brisbane creche; Spanish monks and nuns teach Aboriginal children at New Norcia, a mission in Western Australia; families shown mining mica at Harts Range in the Northern terrotory and a Victorian fashion parade as models exhibit the latest styles in woollen clothing.
